text: Python: How to find script's directory
I use os.getcwd() to get the script file's directory location.
When I run the script from the command line it gives me the correct path whereas when I run it from a script run by code in a django view it prints /.

childList.text: get the script file's directory location

text: How can I get the path to the script from within a script run by a django view?

UPDATE:
Summing up the answers thus far - os.getcwd() and os.path.abspath() both give the current working directory which may or may not be the directory where the script resides.
In my web host setup __file__ gives only the filename without the path.
Isn't there any way in Python to (always) be able to receive the path in which the script resides?
